symptoms: Dull pain near the navel or the upper abdomen that becomes sharp as it moves to the lower right abdomen
Nausea and/or vomiting soon after abdominal pain begins
notice: That are the symptoms of appendicitis, go to Emergency.

symptoms: severe pain in the left chest area / behind the sternum
notice: Call an ambulance, calm the sick, raise the upper body, loosen tight clothing (tie, collar, etc.)
Whenever a stroke is suspected, it should be viewed as a life-threatening emergency. It is therefore particularly important to recognize a stroke quickly.
See your GP if you have persistent or worrying symptoms that you think could be caused by kidney disease

symptoms: Excessive coughing or a cough that keeps you awake at night
